summary: Charles W. Sandman is identified as the Chief of the Contract Personnel Division within an organization (likely the CIA, based on the document context). His role, as evidenced by the documents, involves managing and overseeing consultant agreements, including their termination. Specifically, he is mentioned in a memorandum advising the Office of Finance about the termination of consultant agreements effective June 30, 1974. While the documents do not explicitly link Sandman to the JFK assassination, his position within the Contract Personnel Division suggests he was involved in the administrative aspects of managing personnel, including consultants, within the organization during the relevant time frame.
significance: While not directly linked to the JFK assassination in these documents, Charles W.
